programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Iowa farmer Tom Lyon is excited when a nearby plot of land goes up for sale, but he isn't the only one. When Lyon's body is discovered at the bottom of a well, the trail of blood leads through that very land.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: The people of Defiance, Iowa, find it strange when Scott Shanahan disappears, leaving his wife and kids, but Scott is always unpredictable and no one gives it much more thought.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When drug-addicted casino owner Ted Binion turns up dead in his mansion, the suspects are pure Vegas: an ex-stripper girlfriend, a contractor who knew where his silver was buried, and a mob boss who launders money through his casino.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Rocky Mount, North Carolina, a mortician falls in love in his funeral parlor; while in Mustang, Oklahoma, a sexual obsession turns deadly.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Lebanon, Maine, an estranged wife trying to start a new life can't escape her violent past; while in Vincennes, Indiana, a married engineer falls for the babysitter, but it leads to murder.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: A husband carefully plans a murder; a love triangle leads to a deadly conspiracy.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: Love and lust leads to murders in Atlanta and Colorado.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: A church minister and a teacher fall for a student.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: A pregnant wife is killed execution style; an EMT is intent on taking a life.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extrao secuestr a Polly Klaas de doce aos durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entr en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitacin y descubrieron, a travs del uso de fuentes de luz lser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Despus de una extensa investigacin de dos meses, el FBI arrest a Richard Allen Davis. La impresin de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A cunning predator was loose in rural South Carolinaabducting young women from their own front yards in broad daylight. He was also a sadist, calling one victim's family, taunting them, boosting and then dashing their hopes. Local investigators called on the FBI to help them find this clever serial killer. Like a game of chess, FBI profilers and forensic examiners were able to outwit the killer, and put an end to his deadly game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On October 2, 1987, a Boston police officer responding to a domestic disturbance call was fatally wounded. Local authorities launched a citywide manhunt, but were only able to find the fingerprints of the chief suspect. Believing that he had fled the area, the FBI followed the suspect's trail to the west coast and then across the Mexican border, always aware of the desperation of a cop killer and of the need for justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: He wandered the streets of New York City wearing only pajamas and a bathrobe, but the FBI was convinced that Vince Gigante, the reputed boss of the Genovese crime family, was anything but crazy. The FBI used undercover surveillance, secret audio tapes, six mobsters turned government informants and the testimony of twelve FBI agents to help convict Gigante of murder and conspiracy-to-murder, including a plot to kill rival mob boss John Gotti.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A California bank manager panics and calls in the FBI after the door to his vault refuses to open. Upon inspection, the vault has been blasted into from the ceiling, and over $2 million in valuables is gone. When agents find no clues as to the robbers or their whereabouts in California, they send details of the crime to other FBI field offices. It is not long before agents in Ohio are investigating a bank vault robbery that is strikingly similar to the California heist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: From May until July of 1984, Alton Coleman and his common law wife, Denise Brown, engaged in a gruesome crime spree that spanned six states and left eight people dead including children. The FBI coordinated law enforcement efforts throughout the entire country in order to track the couple. Their expertise in conducting manhunts for the nation's most horrible killers paid off. The couple was located and apprehended as they prepared to kill again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Four inmates from a Delaware Correctional Center turn up missing in the middle of the night. A few hours later, a stolen vehicle is recovered; inside, one of the inmate's fingerprints is found, as well as the address book of one of the other fugitives. A multi-state manhunt ensues with the help of the FBI. A nearby robbery report is the agent's first tip, followed by a murder in the same neighborhood.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February 1988, a record store clerk in Sandusky, Ohio, was fatally shot in his van. After discovering a night deposit bag with thousands of dollars in the vehicle, police knew that robbery was not the motive, and began to investigate other possibilities. FBI agents learned that several motorcycle gang members had been stopped nearby on a traffic violation shortly after the murder and theorized that the clerk's murder may have been a botched hit carried out by a gang member.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the Spring of 1997, a killer preying on senior citizens terrorizes the River Parish area of Southern Louisiana. By May, local police and the New Orleans FBI are exploring a connection between the April 9 murder of a 71-year old widow and the May 9 murder of a retired couple. A month later, authorities forward information on the crimes to the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit in Quantico, VA, hoping a profile will help them narrow the field of possible suspects.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: A gruesome video on a stolen SD card exposes Brian Steven Smith's secret double life; David Scott confronts this soft-spoken husband and serial killer about his nighttime hunts for vulnerable Alaskan women.

programme.title: Interview With a Killer
programme.desc: Tyler Hadley discusses how he, as a troubled 17-year-old, bludgeoned his mother and father to death with a hammer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, the FBI began a massive undercover operation, code named Safebet, that was designed to expose the Chicago Mafia's infiltration into the city's surrounding suburbs. Undercover agents quickly discovered that the mob had its tentacles spread into every facet of the law enforcement community. They unwittingly uncovered the murder of a wealthy socialite perpetrated by a jealous and greedy mob lawyer and covered up by the local police chief.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In January 1984, a U.S. Customs official disappears from his post near the Del Rio, Texas border crossing, prompting local police to search for four Latin American suspects driving a Pontiac Grand Prix. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre d Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~150,000 of their own money into their trendy caf bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's third programme is Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front. Big soul momma, owner Charita Jones, produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault but the punters are nowhere to be seen, Head Chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey - and despite working a seven-day week Charita's got an empty restaurant and a ~65,000 debt.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Applegate, Oregon, to try to rescue the failing Applegate River Lodge. Despite being over a million dollars in debt, the owner, Richard Davis, is more interested in smoking cannabis than he is in fixing the problems of this family-built inn.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Starkville, Mississippi to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having over 40 years experience in the hotel business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss on how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits West Dover in Vermont, to try to save a dog-friendly hotel thats desperately in need of help. Sandy MacDougall, the owner, runs the hotel like a hostel with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests.

programme.title: The Perfect Vagina

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for 300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing 5,000 a week.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and dcor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon checks in to Connecticuts oldest inn, the Curtis House. This historic inn has been run by the Hardisty family for generations, but the business has started to fall apart and the family legacy is on the brink of being lost.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the Historic Calumet Inn, in Pipestone, Minnesota. Joint owners, Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the inn as a gift by their father (who they still call daddy), and they treat it with less respect than a dolls house.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is La Lanterna in Letchworth, Hertfordshire. Twenty-eight-year-old owner and head chef Alex offers modern Italian cuisine, a taste of Little Italy in England's first garden city, and the restaurant is run by his best mate maitre d Gavin, helped by his ex-air hostess girlfriend Emily. But Alex has no customers, cookers that don't work and an expensive menu that's about as authentically Italian as a spag bol.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is D-Place in Chelmsford, Essex run by Mexican-born Israel and his English partner Tara. They've sunk ~150,000 of their own money into their trendy caf bar which offers a vast selection of fusion cuisine. In charge is Executive Chef Philippe, producing everything from all-day breakfasts to hoi sin noodles with an astounding lack of flair; the plastic food is dire and boomerangs back from the dining room as soon as it's cooked.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's third programme is Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater a stone's throw from Brighton's sea front. Big soul momma, owner Charita Jones, produces a menu of irresistibly unique classics from the Deep South. The food's hard to fault but the punters are nowhere to be seen, Head Chef Brian and a rag-tag collection of part-timers are taking the mickey - and despite working a seven-day week Charita's got an empty restaurant and a ~65,000 debt.

programme.desc: Will we ever find the answers? Or, might these structures have been intentionally constructed to perpetually mystify us?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: For decades, the debate has raged as to what exactly unidentified flying objects really are; theories have been put forth that attribute UFOs to everything from secret military aircraft to weather phenomena and more.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Genius is widely considered to be the ability to change the world in an incredible way, like inventing new technology, deciphering the mysteries of the universe, or creating transcendent art, but its origin is a mystery.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Could a cache of fantastic riches have been buried centuries ago on a tiny island in the North Atlantic?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Abandoned cities. Ancient cultures nearly erased by time. And colossal empires that simply vanished without a trace. How does a civilization become "lost?"

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Humans can survive catastrophic injuries and deadly scenarios that defy the odds in ways that are inexplicable; these survivals challenge the best attempts to explain how anyone could live through such circumstances.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In 1947 an unknown object approaching US air space at great speed and a civilian craft out of El Paso were heading towards each other when they disappeared from radar.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: NASA has been exploring space for decades, and there are persistent reports that the agency has uncovered surprising information about UFOs. The team speaks with former astronauts, employees and engineers, and delves into NASA videos.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In the 1970s and 80s, military pilots allegedly not only saw UFOS, but engaged them. The team gets special access to ex-pilots in Iran and Peru who followed strange objects on hair-raising chases later investigated by the US Military.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team is hot on the trail of a case that just happened, one that had the whole country talking just weeks ago. In December 2007, people begin seeing UFOs in the skies ninety miles from Dallas, Texas. Within a month, the reports had increased ten-fold.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In May of 2008, the UK's Ministry of Defense made decades' worth of classified files on UFOs freely available to the public. One month later, UFO hysteria ripped through the country. In June, a police helicopter crew spotted unusual aircraft in Wales.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: There are approximately 30,000 commercial flights in the United States every day, and as the number of flights increase, so does the proximity of UFO encounters.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: On November 11th 1987, the small town of Gulf Breeze, Florida is inundated with UFO sightings. More than 200 witnesses see strange, unexplained lights in the sky. The strange sightings last through the early 1990s.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In January 1984, a U.S. Customs official disappears from his post near the Del Rio, Texas border crossing, prompting local police to search for four Latin American suspects driving a Pontiac Grand Prix. The following day, the Customs official was found dead. Two state troopers recovered the missing officer's service revolver after a fatal altercation with two men. Local police and the FBI continued searching for the suspect vehicle, prepared for a confrontation with desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1997, a triple murder terrified residents in the nation's capital. In a Georgetown coffee shop, three employees were shot to death. Investigators could find no immediate suspects and no clear motive for the attack. Evidence at the crime scene pointed in many different directions. Was this a hate crime, a robbery gone wrong, or an act of cold-blooded vengeance against one of the victims?

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Police investigate two brutal murders in two small towns located hundreds of miles apart. The crimes seem random and unrelated, until investigators discover a terrifying link. Local police and the FBI must untangle a web of liesto stop a dangerous gang that will kill a man for his Identity.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, Seven inmates break out of a high security prison in New Mexico. The escapees, all violent criminals, are a threat to anyone who crosses their path. State and local police and the FBI know they must capture these men before they rob, rape and killagain.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Boston, FBI agents and local police tracked a gang of robbers who specialized in armored car takedowns. Their MO was familiar -- the gang used precise timing to steal millions in cash and burned their getaway cars to destroy evidence. As the robberies grew more violent, agents launched a complex sting: To trap a deadly ring of thieves and shut down their dangerous operation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On December 21, 1998, two gunmen kidnap three janitors on their way to clean the Bank of America ATM repository in Las Vegas. The gunmen force the janitors to let them in the ATM repository and hold them hostage until the armored car guards arrive to make their nightly collection. When the guards enter the bank, the gunmen surprise them and shoot one guard in the chest before escaping with $1,088,000, the largest bank robbery take in Las Vegas history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On October 2, 1987, a Boston police officer responding to a domestic disturbance call was fatally wounded. Local authorities launched a citywide manhunt, but were only able to find the fingerprints of the chief suspect. Believing that he had fled the area, the FBI followed the suspect's trail to the west coast and then across the Mexican border, always aware of the desperation of a cop killer and of the need for justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1988, new light was shed on the mysterious death of a South Carolina farmer when a criminal confessed that two prominent community members hired him to commit murder. Local police and FBI agents arrested a wealthy businessman and later learned that, even behind bars, he commanded the power to corrupt and kill. Using prison informants, agents had to prevent him from murdering again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In January 1984, a U.S. Customs official disappears from his post near the Del Rio, Texas border crossing, prompting local police to search for four Latin American suspects driving a Pontiac Grand Prix. The following day, the Customs official was found dead. Two state troopers recovered the missing officer's service revolver after a fatal altercation with two men. Local police and the FBI continued searching for the suspect vehicle, prepared for a confrontation with desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: An Arkansas State Trooper is shot and killed after pulling over a van for a traffic violation. Officers apprehend the shooter, after a car chase and shootout. ATF is alerted when officers find weapons and explosives in the man's vehicle. Further testing of the weapons reveals one was used in a murder several months earlier. ATF traces some of the firearms to purchases made by another man from and arms dealer. They also match silencer marks from the weapons to a third man previously arrested for stealing a flatbed truck.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1970s, the FBI had a working knowledge of anti-Castro terrorists operating in the United States. But then a new group appeared, more violent and aggressive than their predecessors. All agents had to go on was a series of chilling phone calls, a mysterious voice, and the threat of more violence. FBI field offices from New York to Miami coordinated their efforts, determined to catch the vicious killers.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1991, the Safe Streets Task Force, a joint FBI / Washington D.C. Metropolitan Police Department organization, begins conducting an investigation into the violent activities of a local gang called the K Street Crew. Gang members are suspected of involvement in several area homicides. The FBI approaches several witnesses, hoping to convince them to testify against the gang members. Seven potential witnesses are murdered during the course of the investigation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Lincoln County, Nebraska, a fugitive drug dealer engaged in a shootout with state troopers, wounding two of them, and eluded capture after a high-speed chase. Authorities immediately set up a statewide manhunt, connecting the fugitive to a murder in western Nebraska. A chance sighting led FBI agents to a second confrontation with the killer, who was more determined than ever to escape the law.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a career criminal committed a vehicular homicide in New Orleans, FBI agents tracked him through his habits and addictions. They focused their investigation on gambling communities throughout the country and, when he resurfaced in Atlantic City, authorities used all of their resources to trap an elusive sociopath who claimed that he would never be taken alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Washington D.C, a car bomb takes the life of a former ambassador and his secretary. The FBI is on the case and begins sifting through layers of a wide-ranging conspiracy. The scope of the investigation broadens when it becomes apparent that a foreign government, ruled by a ruthless dictator, ordered the attack. Agents and prosecutors must engage in a political tug-of-war to uncover the identities of the assassins.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February 1988, a record store clerk in Sandusky, Ohio, was fatally shot in his van. After discovering a night deposit bag with thousands of dollars in the vehicle, police knew that robbery was not the motive, and began to investigate other possibilities. FBI agents learned that several motorcycle gang members had been stopped nearby on a traffic violation shortly after the murder and theorized that the clerk's murder may have been a botched hit carried out by a gang member.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980's, a pair of serial bank robbers gained a reputation among law enforcement officials as formidable bandits. Using the same modus operandi, the two men took hostages and emptied bank vaults across the Midwest. After the criminals escaped from police custody, FBI agents familiar with the bandits believed that they would attempt a grand-scale heist. By conducting surveillance on known associates of the criminals, authorities tried to anticipate the next target.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980's the New York City Police Department is fighting a losing battle in the war on drugs. Distributors and drug gangs in New York are making millions, and they will do anything to protect their profits. After two law enforcement officers are targeted, hundreds of police officers and FBI agents devise a bold plan to crackdown on the drug gangs and shut down their deadly business.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1970s, the FBI had a working knowledge of anti-Castro terrorists operating in the United States. programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June of 2000, two gunmen rob a Seattle, WA bank, and flee on foot as officers chase them. One of the gunmen is killed in a firefight with police, the other escapes after assaulting a family and using their home to hide. The family helps FBI agents identify the man, who is suspected of several other robberies. Seattle SWAT teams, working with the FBI, search the home of the assailant's mother, and find ammunition matching that used at the bank robbery.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1970's, Otpor, a violent arm of the Croatian National Resistance commits terroristic acts against non-supportive Croatians living in the U.S. With the help of an informant, the FBI is able to apprehend, arrest and convict members of the group for crimes ranging from conspiracy and extortion to murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1980s, the FBI matches wits with a cunning bank robber -- a lone gunman responsible for the longest string of unsolved bank robberies in FBI history. The robber's planning is meticulous. He executes his crimes with military precision. It will take the combined skills of local police and dozens of agents to catch a criminal mastermind they call, "The Shootist."

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a rash of home invasion robberies take place in the metropolitan Detroit area. The thieves turn out to be part of a local gang dubbed the Home Invaders. Their crimes extend to insurance fraud, theft, and illegal lottery schemes. The Violent Crimes Task Force (VCTF) opens an investigation, and with the cooperation of a gang member who was apprehended at the scene of a crime, they are able to obtain the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 16 gang members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1984, the son of a successful real estate developer was kidnapped in front of his father's business in Miami. After the father received a $3 million ransom demand from a self-proclaimed terrorist, the FBI became involved. Based on witness descriptions of the car used in the kidnapping, authorities began to suspect a pair of Colombian nationals with a known grudge against the developer's family.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Four inmates from a Delaware Correctional Center turn up missing in the middle of the night. A few hours later, a stolen vehicle is recovered; inside, one of the inmate's fingerprints is found, as well as the address book of one of the other fugitives. A multi-state manhunt ensues with the help of the FBI. A nearby robbery report is the agent's first tip, followed by a murder in the same neighborhood.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Boston, FBI agents and local police tracked a gang of robbers who specialized in armored car takedowns. As the robberies grew more violent, agents launched a complex sting: To trap a deadly ring of thieves and shut down their dangerous operation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Native American woman was brutally killed in the desert of New Mexico, and the crime scene was rich in forensic evidence: tire tracks, shoe impressions and even the murder weapons.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Exploring how an American hit single from 1966 -- "The Cheater" by Bob Kuban and the In-Men -- foreshadowed the demise of the group's lead singer, Walter Scott.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 Seattle murder of suburban couple Raquel Rivera & Jay Johnson is detailed. Evidence from the couple's dog Chief eventually ties one of the murderers to the scene. This is one of the first cases where dog DNA was used to convict.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The sensitive nose of a forensic examiner sniffs out murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder investigation in St. Petersburg, Florida, crosses jurisdictions from New York and Jamaica. The police rely on cell phone mapping, wiretapping and a host of forensic evidence to link a suspect to a murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of Philadelphia college athlete Aimee Willard is investigated after her car was found on the roadside. When her body is found, the police find unusual marks on her body and DNA evidence that eventually lead to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: California police had several suspects in the robbery and brutal murder of an elderly couple. Ten years later, a determined forensic scientist used material from a dentist's office to uncover ballistic evidence which had been overlooked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the head chef of a historic Philadelphia restaurant was found dead, investigators interviewed the usual suspects: family, friends and coworkers. As they sifted through the evidence, police uncovered a chilling tale of debt and deceit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A suspicious fire swept through an apartment killing two young women. The cause of the fire and the identity of the victims were unclear. But a closer look at the fire scene revealed something hidden in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: At a murder scene, investigators find a shoe-print, several foreign hairs, and unknown fingerprints. But they believe the most telling piece of evidence is the bite mark on the victim's chest.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: 1984 Rajneeshee bioterror attack: investigators uncover a plot to overthrow the government after a unique strain of salmonella makes people ill.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is killed while walking her dogs in the woods. Since she had no enemies and her husband has an alibi, police assume it was a hunting accident...until a strange letter turns up allegedly written by the woman before her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two eyewitnesses may hold the key to the death of a motorcycle gang member.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For years, a woman suffered from what appeared to be the unpleasant side effects of lithium, a drug prescribed to treat bipolar disorder. When she died, investigators had to determine if her death was due to natural causes, suicide, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An obstetrician returned home from the hospital and found his wife on the bathroom floor. She was covered with blood and not breathing. He tried unsuccessfully to revive her, staining his clothes with her blood in the process, and then he called 911.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An unusual case involving the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest. After Chris Ochoa confessed, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. DNA evidence cleared Ochoa while proving that Marino was the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Residents of Noel, Missouri were stunned to learn that their bank had been robbed and the bank president was missing. His body was later found floating in a lake, securely bound to a chair with duct tape.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 34-year-old nurse experiences a variety of flu-like symptoms. None of her doctors are able to discover the cause, until she visits the gynecologist for a routine check-up. Then she learns it's something far worse than the flu.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A high school gym teacher mysteriously left town, without saying goodbye to anyone. He later sent letters to explain why. But a closer forensic look at those letters, and a microscopic piece of tissue, gave investigators an entirely different explanation for where he went and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young TV news producer is raped and murdered in her apartment. Police identify two suspects, but both are cleared of any wrongdoing. The case stalls for more than a year, and then investigators turn to the Commonwealth of Virginia's DNA Databank.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into 48-year-old Martha Hansen's murder in Anchorage is helped by a legal requirement that bars have video cameras installed on the premises. Using video, hair and blood evidence, investigators determine that Evans Lee Curtis was the murderer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman disappeared without a trace, there were two possible explanations: kidnapping or murder. Careful investigation, a forensic artist, and DNA profiling enabled police to find a single suspect, who was known to prey upon vulnerable women.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police are dispatched to the scene of a shooting, and discover the victim's husband is one of their own: a homicide detective who says his wife accidentally shot herself in the head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 19-year-old woman was found dead in her car; the scene had been staged to make murder appear to be suicide. During their investigation, police discovered the victim was involved in a love quadrangle, giving several people a motive to kill her.

programme.title: Murder: Fight for the Truth
programme.desc: Find a sinister motive in the case of a newlywed shot seven times at her door.

programme.title: Murder: Fight for the Truth
programme.desc: Lift the lid on a chilling, 30-year-old rape-murder case with two rookie cops.

programme.title: The Family Court Murders
programme.desc: Dig into the unsolved murder of the killers brother-in-law with Debi Marshall.

programme.title: The Family Court Murders
programme.desc: Learn how the killers wife escaped his abuse and search for a missing sister.

programme.title: Murder: Fight for the Truth
programme.desc: Untangle a web of secrets and betrayals in a 35-year-old home invasion case.

programme.title: Murder: Fight for the Truth
programme.desc: Revisit a puzzling crime scene where a firefighters hunch unmasked a killer.

programme.title: #Murder

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers in Elverton-cum-Latterly are up in arms and divided, over the building of a supermarket. Things soon come to a head when independent environmental supervisor, Frank Hopkirk, is found stabbed to death at a Jubb's Timber Yard, the site of the new supermarket, by a pair of children. When Barnaby and Jones investigate to determine who wanted Hopkirk dead, they find out that he secretly came to the village under various aliases for sexual rendezvous with various women in fantasy role-playing scenarios, and that he had been making further investigations on the future development site and having doubts over claims it was contaminated. Either someone didn't like his investigations, or someone didn't like his sexual appetite, but either way, Barnaby finds himself investigating lies and more to uncover the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A few months ago, Annie Woodrow was arrested, accused of murdering her friend, Frances Trevelyan, on the motive of wanting Frances' husband. Her time in court has come, but DCI Barnaby is certain she still is holding things back in regards to the murder, and decides to monitor the trial. Yet a chance remark by Frances' youngest daughter, and a meeting with an old friend and psychiatrist, makes him begin to doubt the evidence for her conviction. Soon he and DC Jones, awaiting news of his promotion to DS, find themselves reinvestigating the case, and it soon becomes clear that they may have missed details that could implicate another in the murder.

programme.desc: In the village of Broughton, a ninety-year-old battle of the sexes has often occurred, with men trying to oppose an event that the women have managed to successfully hold without interruption, until it culminates with casualties on both sides - Mildred Danvers, an elderly woman who had returned on the day of a funeral and poisoned in her hotel room, and Rev. Anthony Gant, shot during a major event being held in the village green, in view of many. It soon becomes clear someone may have wished to kill both to cover up a dark truth, and soon Barnaby has to figure out who amongst the village wanted both dead, complicated further when Gant's curate is murdered next.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. In this Bloomberg Originals documentary, we reveal how the unregulated substance is being promoted and even made more potent, and how some users are ending up dead.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Mikeys getting married soon and the clock is ticking to get his teeth picture-perfect. Lynns embarrassed by the color of her teeth and wont wait another moment for a white smile. Can the FIXT team get the work done in time?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In a serene community, a beloved doctor is bludgeoned in her own home. Investigators uncover a conspiracy that rocks the close-knit neighborhood to its core.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Indulge in the old-school classics that have reigned in the Midwest for decades. From Wisconsin cheese curds to Kansas City's burnt ends, enjoy these unique comfort foods that are as timeless as they are tasty.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasnt had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Stitch

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminals and a casino magnates family forever.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: In these real-life stories of the illicit drug trade, learn how law enforcement beats the smugglers in their high-stakes game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each others signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponents creation.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasnt had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore

programme.title: Refugees Welcome: A Story of Immigration to Americas Heartland

programme.title: Good To Know

programme.title: Primarily Primates
programme.desc: In this episode we meet human's closest relatives - primates. See what makes a chimpanzee one of the most intelligent primates. Find out why the spider monkey is such an amazing climber and feel the power of the howler monkey's howl.

programme.title: Surf and Turf
programme.desc: In this episode we'll find out how sharks use electro-sensors to detect their prey. Also, discover the skunk's stinky defense mechanism. And domestic versus wild - see how the striped zebra matches up against its cousin the horse.

programme.title: Ecosystems
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the Everglades of Florida and travels these waters by airboat to discover wildlife. Then we visit Yellowstone and explore this unique ecosystem that remains relatively undisturbed. We'll also look at planet Earth as one giant ecosystem, and examine the inter-dependency of all living things.

programme.title: Extreme Weather
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau ventures to Mt. Washington in New Hampshire, a place known as the "Home of the World's Worst Weather." We visit the "Wall of Wind" in Florida where scientists simulate hurricane force winds. In Colorado, we follow a scientific research team pursuing a tornado. We travel to Texas Tech, where they explore the destruction of debris thrown by tornadoes.

programme.title: Incredible Animals
programme.desc: In this episode we'll see the amazing strength of the leaf cutter ant. Find out how fast can a pronghorn really run, and how the desert camel is able to survive in such extreme conditions.

programme.title: Journey to Africa
programme.desc: In this episode we meet the animals of Africa. We'll see how the zebra able to use its stripes as camouflage against its colorblind nemesis. Explore the engineering of a giraffes neck, and feel the power of a hyena jaws.

programme.title: Japan
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Japan

programme.title: Big Sur
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Big Sur

programme.title: Afghanistan Withdrawal
programme.desc: Scripps News explores the lives impacted by the U.S. troop withdrawal from Afghanistan in 2021. Critics say the government's decision lacked foresight, ultimately forcing the U.S. to take on tens of thousands of refugees. More than two years later, those refugees are still struggling to get back on their feet.

programme.title: Hurricane Michael
programme.desc: A look at how rebuilding efforts are going for Florida families that lost everything in the category 5 Hurricane Michael that made landfall in the FL panhandle on October 7, 2018. The episode goes into the complicated insurance process and how disasters price out people that used to live there. Several FL stations' coverage and talent featured in the episode.

programme.title: Who Will Care: Family Caregivers In America
programme.desc: A special conversation with Yvette Nicole Brown ("Community"), Marg Helgenberger ("CIS") and Diedrich Bader ("Veep") as they open up about a silent struggle in their lives.

programme.title: The Cure For HIV
programme.desc: A growing number of people around the world are said to now be cured of HIV. Inside the quest to eradicate the virus and the promising progress.

programme.title: Good To Know
programme.desc: Discover inspirational news, with real-life stories of everyday people who positively impact their communities.

programme.title: Good To Know
programme.desc: Discover inspirational news, with real-life stories of everyday people who positively impact their communities.

programme.title: America's Wild Horse Problem
programme.desc: The U.S. wild horse population is soaring, creating an ecological disaster across the American West. Ranchers and horse advocates are divided on what to do about it.

programme.title: Tomorrow's Wave
programme.desc: As surfing expands in its popularity and geography, surfers are using science to perfect and preserve waves - and bring the sport beyond the coasts.

programme.title: The Vampire Teens
programme.desc: A group of high school outcasts are on the run through the Southeastern United States after their leader commits a savage double homicide. Cops finally catch the thrill-seeking teens, only to find out they're a makeshift vampire cult.

programme.title: The Preacher, His Mistress, And Murder
programme.desc: When a wife and mother overdoses in a small Texas town, almost no one suspects foul play. The family forces investigators to dig deeper, only to find out she was murdered by the last person anyone would have expected.

programme.title: The Sadist Of San Luis Obispo
programme.desc: A sexual predator on early release from prison turns the quiet town of San Luis Obispo into a hunting ground, preying on young, unsuspecting, college age women. Through persistence and the tiniest of clues, law enforcement finally tracks down the sadistic killer and brings him to justice.

programme.title: The Bladerunner
programme.desc: An Olympic hero shoots his girlfriend at his home in the middle of the night. Has he mistaken her for an intruder or is it all part of a precisely calculated plot to get away with murder?

programme.title: The Gainesville Ripper
programme.desc: An evil ex-con on the run for attempted murder sets up camp in Gainesville, Florida. But, he's not satisfied just hiding out. This seasoned killer's bloodlust cannot be controlled and he won't stop killing until he's paid back society for his eight years behind bars.

programme.title: The Con Artist Killers
programme.desc: Mother and son grifters crisscross the United States, pulling off every scam and con imaginable. But when these criminal masterminds graduate to multiple homicides, they're finally caught by the long arms of the law.

programme.title: A Woman Scorned
programme.desc: A promising young attorney is shot and killed in a jealous rage by an obsessed, on-again off-again girlfriend. But can she convince the jury that she's the victim and get away with murder?

programme.title: The Fast Food Killer
programme.desc: A short order cook with aspirations of country stardom falls on hard times. With his dreams crushed, he returns to what he knows best stick ups only this time his armed robberies result in a ruthless spree of killing fast food workers.

programme.title: Operation Exeter: Undercover Senior Year
programme.desc: Exeter, California is a rural town of 10,000 residents and a thriving high school drug trade. Police officer, Alex Salinas, a baby-faced 22-year-old newly graduated from the Academy, poses as a high school senior who lands himself in detention to set up drug buys with fellow students. He purchases marijuana, cocaine, hydrocodone, and other drugs, which leads to the arrest of 13 students. When the amount of drug trafficking is uncovered, it's a wakeup call for the community and the students themselves.

programme.title: Operation Payclip: Bribery In The Big Easy
programme.desc: The Port of New Orleans is the stage for an operation aimed at union extortion. FBI agents go undercover to infiltrate the lucrative cargo ship cleaning business enabled by illegal payments and false paperwork. Through a fabricated Trojan-horse cleaning operation, agents uncover a drug-infested underworld of racketeering and kickbacks to dodge taxes and regulations. The operation closes down an illegal industry making millions from government loopholes and fabricated documents.

programme.title: Operation Casablanca: Tracing The Cali Cartel's Cash
programme.desc: U.S. Customs spearheads a sting aimed at Mexican bankers laundering money for the Cali and Juarez cartels. Customs sends agent William Gately undercover to infiltrate the financier's ranks, posing as money launderers. They bribe bankers and launder more than $100 million through Mexican financial institutions. In the end they disrupt the cartels operations and the U.S. government freezes accounts totaling more than $110 million. The operation leads to the arrests of 167 people, including 26 Mexican bankers.

programme.title: Operation Iceman: Taking Down The Mafia's Hitman
programme.desc: During a volatile period of organized crime, ATF agent Dominick Polifrone assumes the role of a "wise-guy" to gain the confidence of and incriminate the mafia's most prolific hitman, Richard "The Iceman" Kuklinski. Authorities have known about the Iceman's talents for some time, but no one could have guessed how many people this mild mannered family man has killed. In a bold attempt to build a case, Agent Polifrone befriends the man many have called "the devil himself."

programme.title: Morning Rush

programme.title: Scripps News On The Scene
programme.desc: Each weekday, Scripps News reporters take you to breaking news and live events across the country, bringing you the news as it unfolds.

programme.title: Happening Now In America
programme.desc: Follow what's happening across America with up-to-the minute details on the major events driving the day's top stories.

programme.title: Today As It Happened
programme.desc: What happened today? Find out as Scripps News gets you up to speed on the day's events that everyone is talking about.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Costumes are a part of the fabric that makes up New Orleans. As three local designers will find out nothing is easy in the Big Easy as they compete in creating one-of-a-kind costumes inspired by the Crescent City and the river that shapes it.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Beach-inspired resin art in Boston, and elaborate charcuterie boards in Omaha.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: A horrific accident doomed Allison to a lifetime of pain and failed surgeries. In search of a brighter smile, Mar-cias seen half a dozen dentists, but remains unsatisfied. Can FIXT tech meet the needs of their deserving clients?

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a car crashing into a home to a lemur fleeing a DUI scene, these captivating real-life stories explore intense arrests caught on film.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie invite you along for a fabulous day of decadence and pampering at some of their favorite treat yo-self spots in Sactown.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: In the wake of Hurricane Maria's destruction in Puerto Rico, Justin and Ryan fly down to help communities rebuild and help families any way they can.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasnt had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Seasonal ingredients are the stars of any dish, and Chef Chris Barnum-Dann and Chef Brett Bohlmann prove it in this fully vegetarian episode. Will the judges fawn over their flavors, or will they miss the meat?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Everything's better fried, right? Chefs Melanie Kerr and Colin Liang put that hypothesis to the test in this Fry Fest challenge. Will their ideas come out crisped to perfection, or sad and soggy?

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: From fencing, to ninja warrior training, to boxing and Tai Chi, Rob discovers an inner strength he never knew he hadwhile getting kicked in the keister.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Glenda Macatangay has conquered her career and being a single mom to four kids. But when it comes to being comfortable in the outdoors, she isnt as confident. Kinga meets up with Glenda in Sacramento, CA to introduce her to the wonders of the wilderness.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A teenager vanishes from her home one fall morning in 1999. Her body is discovered 17 days later, seven miles away. It takes more than 15 years for the heartbreaking truth to come out.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Birminghams favorite bartenders take Kate on a world tour of cocktails with tropical tiki showstoppers, aromatic Middle Eastern flavors, blue-collar dive bar favorites, and Kates first and truest love agave spirits.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Jessie Fiacco is a single mother and nurse, who during the pandemic made home visits. But Jessie hasnt made time for herself. Luckily for her, Kinga is in town to show Jessie she doesnt have to travel far to get far out.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Discover where classic dishes collide to create delightful flavors. From pizza debates to the Juicy Lucy to a good old-fashioned red beer, see how regional creativity transforms beloved foods into something more.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Go on a kayak adventure, grab some unique eats, and zipline your heart out on a trip to this happening city on the Monongahela river.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are always looking for that next new thing. Join them as they explore a few of Sactown's surprising offerings, from mobile archery to an intimate cocktail bar with over 700 bottles of unique liquor.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan wields the baton leading the orchestra, achieves his dream of performing with a cast of Queens, and serves up das boot with German local legends.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the citys unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: News Fallback: Hour Long Docs
programme.desc: Long form storytelling from Very Local.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminals and a casino magnates family forever.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One evening in 1999, Cythnia Jaramillo shows up at a home wearing nothing but a dog collar. She had been tortured and sexually assaulted for days. Her escape leads investigators to discover a gruesome string of kidnappings and murders.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Host Dave Holmes meets celebrity guests at the airport bar to discuss must-do activities in cities across America. So when youre ready to board your next flight, youll have an Esquire-approved itinerary.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: 84% of women have been harassed while running. Not Today, by Runner's World, examines this through the stories of three runners. Mollie Tibbetts and Wendy Martinez were both brutally murdered, while Kelly Herron fought off her attacker and survived.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Michigan where small businesses owners are finding solutions to lower health care costs. Plus, an expert on presidential transitions breaks down the process. And, we travel to James Madisons Montpelier estate to learn how archaeologists are digging to uncover the history of the people buried there.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasnt had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Dive into the Midwest's fried delights. From Friday night fish fries to tasty testicles and fried grilled cheese? Enjoy the area's most iconic and delectable crispy fried goodness.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: Scott's life revolves around everyone's favorite four-legged friends, from rescuing and caring for countless dogs, his spirit is unwavering. Today Meaghan gives back a day full of moments for him and his beloved canine companion.
